Actually, I would prefer a mimic to a shape-shifter.  The mimic has no 
specials except to duplicate anyone else's specials within a certain 
range.  The only catch would be it could only duplicate specials if it 
had the stats to do so.  Ideally, you would fight this character from 
long range and never, ever, let is get close to a mage, cleric, or 
archmage.  The most dangerous thing out there is a mage who can freeze 
time and also has lots of poitions of magic.

That leads me to another class, which is the only class that will 
break the rule about max of 4 specials plus alternates:
Chemist- Ability to create potions, all 5 of them.  I am putting these 
in order from weakest to strongest, IMHO.  His basic attack is a small 
knife.  His 1st special is speed potion.  the Alternate is create a 
speed poition, which requires level 25 intelligence.  the 2nd special 
is potion of flight, wich requires level 4 experience.  The alternate 
requires the same amount of experience, plus level 50 intelligence and 
is create a potion of flight.  The 3rd special is potion of magic, 
which requires experience level 6.  The alternate is create a potion 
of magic, which in addition, requires level 75 intelligence.  The 4th 
special is potion of invisibility, which requires experience level 8. 
 The alternate is create a potion of invisibility and requires 
intelligence level 100.  The 5th special is potion of invulnerability 
and requires experience level 10.  The alternate is create a potion of 
invulnerability and requires intelligence level 125.
